intro: Hypochaeris nana, commonly known as the common mouse-ear or lesser mouse-ear, is a small annual herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring a basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom from spring to early summer. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Hypochaeris nana is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and ability to spread through seeds.
